pendingGasChargeInfoModal.title: Why am I seeing a $1 expense?
pendingGasChargeInfoModal.description: Gas stations often place a temporary $1 hold amount when you swipe your card. This placeholder amount is updated to the actual amount within a few days of your purchase.
pendingGasChargeInfoModal.step1Description: You swipe your card at the gas station
pendingGasChargeInfoModal.step2Description: The gas station places a temporary $1 hold on your card
pendingGasChargeInfoModal.step3Description: The $1 charge shows up in your Fyle account
pendingGasChargeInfoModal.step4Description: After a few days, the gas station sends the actual amount to your bank
pendingGasChargeInfoModal.step5Description: The $1 hold in your Fyle account automatically gets updated to reflect the actual amount
pendingGasChargeInfoModal.additionalInfoTitle: Why am I seeing duplicate expenses for the same purchase?
pendingGasChargeInfoModal.additionalInfoDescription: If you've uploaded your receipt through text or email, you might see temporary duplicate expenses in your account for a few days. These expenses will automatically merge into a single expense once the gas station sends the final amount to your bank. You can also manually merge the 2 expenses on your own.
pendingGasChargeInfoModal.readMoreText: Read more on how gas stations expenses are captured in Fyle
